title: Betti numbers and linear covers of points
authors: Hailong Dao, Ben Lund, Sreehari Suresh-Babu
abstract:
We prove that for a finite set of points $X$ in the projective $n$-space over
any field, the Betti number $\beta_{n,n+1}$ of the coordinate ring of $X$ is
non-zero if and only if $X$ lies on the union of two planes whose sum of
dimension is less than $n$. Our proof is direct and short, and the inductive
step rests on a combinatorial statement that works over matroids.
